results.title: Gardening secrets: Summer
results.brief_description: Eion Scarrow, a professional gardener for 40 years, is New Zealand’s best known gardening personality. He and his wife, Ann, own a magnificent display garden in the Waikato, “Willow Glen Gardens”. Using their own garden to demonstrate summer gardening tips, they explain how to care for potted plants when you go away on holidays, how to compost in an open frame structure; care and pruning of citrus trees; mineral deficiencies in the soil; spraying programs and protective equipment for garden pests and diseases; care of variegated plants; deadheading; mulching; safety and care of motor mowers and lawn watering systems and care and preparation of the vegetable garden.

results.title: Gardening secrets: Spring
results.brief_description: In this program devoted to care of the spring garden, well-known New Zealand gardening expert, Eion Scarrow and his wife, Ann, demonstrate the propagation, planting and care of spring vegetables; the planting and care of citrus trees; the pruning of citrus, apples, cherries and camellias; the propagation and potting of indoor plants; basic hydroponics; the preparation and care of a herb garden; broad leaf weed control in lawns; care of garden tools; and summer perennials. Filmed on location at the Scarrow’s garden, Willow Glen, in the Waikato.

results.title: Garden party
results.creator_credit: Jack Sholder, Paul R. Gurian and ACI Films
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a short story by Katherine Mansfield, presenting a story about a garden party which continues uninterrupted by a neighbourhood death. Helps stimulate discussion on the meaning of death. A sensitive approach to a difficult theme. It is recommended that teachers preview this film before screening.

results.title: Garden of the great spirit
results.creator_credit: Barry Gray, Gary Johnson, Amaranth Productions and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: The St Lawrence Islands National Park, located in the Thousand Islands, Ontario, is an area of great natural beauty and historic interest. Geography and weather have created a greater variety of plant life here than anywhere ales in Canada. The film points out the park’s main features while reminding the audience that conservation must be practised to protect the fragile balance of nature. Narrated by Cy Stranger, camera by David M. Ostricker.

results.title: Garden Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Hosted by Graham and Sandra Ross this video is a collection of helpful and practical hints for the home gardener, taken from their popular weekly TV series. The video is divided into four segments: The vegetable garden, The flower garden, Australian natives and a miscellaneous section which includes hanging baskets, terrariums, lawns and fruit fly control.

results.title: Gannets of Bonaventure Island
results.creator_credit: Dan Gibson, Sidney Goldsmith and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This film takes us to Bonaventure Island off the coast of Quebec, to visit a gannet colony. The social life, nesting, laying, incubation and flying of the gannets is shown.

results.title: Gandhi and the end of an Empire
results.creator_credit: Gilles Delannoy, Gaumont-British Instructional and Vision 7
results.brief_description: An informative documentary about Mahatma Gandhi and the important role he played in India’s passage towards independence from British rule. Discusses Gandhi’s life, his beliefs and his aspirations for a united India where Hindus and Muslims live in peace and harmony and where his theories of non-violence and non-cooperation will lead to autonomy and independence. Also provides an indepth look at India’s history from the turn of the century through to Gandhi’s assassination in 1948 discussing the tenets of the Hindu religion; the diversity that exists within India in relation to language, culture and religion; the caste system; the strategies devised by Gandhi to break Britain’s control of India; the violence and bloodshed associated with the independence movement and these divisions; the appointment of Jawaharlal Nehru as leader of the Indian Congress Party; the formation of Pakistan; Britain’s withdrawal from India; India’s independence. Uses archival film footage, stills and newsreels. Narrated by Michel Pascal. Teacher Notes are included. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Game plan for survival (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Dr. George Sheehan, Dr. Kenneth Cooper and other health professionals encourage viewers to select their own regular exercise program to avoid the maladies associated with sedentary and stressful lifestyles.
